children.subject: I took 127 and 189 without 16B. I don’t think either class really required 16B, however I found 127 EXTREMELY hard. I do think 16B might have helped with some of the 127 topics and some of the mathematical maturity needed from 127. For me personally, I think I wish I took 16B before 127 but I know people who did take 127 without 16B and found it fine. As for 189, I feel like it’s a very standalone class (given that you know stats and linear algebra from beforehand). So I never felt at a disadvantage during 189. Stats 134 and math 54 is excellent preparation for 189 (I had 53, 54, and 70 and did well). I don’t think 53 is necessary to do well in 189 but you should just be able to pick it up as you go (just things like Hessians and gradients)
What is your opinion on taking 126 in the same semester as 70?

definitely not recommended, tbh a good standing in cs 70 is the prerequisite for an average score in 126. 126 depends significantly on probability, which CS 70 introduces on. You can do 126 in the semester right after you took 70, but taking some mathy courses before or concurrently with 126 may be helpful (like cs 170, math 53, math 110, or data 100) though it is not required. Similar to a lot of CS math-heavy upper divs, 126 requires a lot of conceptual understanding like self-checking, making sure you fully understand the materials and preparing enough time for the problem sets (scroll through the problems once they are out)

For 126, 16B is very loosely connected, I would say there is almost no correlation except for the last module of 126, which is about decision rule which dabbles a little bit on least square, but the difference is that 16B introduces this topic through algebra, and 126 elaborates on the more conceptual part of Linear Least Square Estimation through geometry, also least square is more covered in 16A than 16B, so don't worry too much about not taking 16B before 126. 

Other than that, I think 126 is more based on 70 (math) so learn your probability really well, which I know most 70 students failed to do because at the end of the semester, the stuff just went over too fast, and usually its enough to rely on your Discrete Math knowledge to get an A. The difficult part about 126 is professor went too shallowly into the examples during the class but the hws can be quadrupled in difficulty (same with the exams)

I took 127 and 189 this semester without 16b. I found them perfectly fine and did well in both. There are only 2-3 weeks of 16b that are relevant to 127 (SVD, PCA, Schur form, Spectral theorem); if you want to be extra prepared you could go over them by yourself before the semester begins. This isn't necessary though.

history.content:
Can anyone tell me what CS (not EE) classes EE16B prepares?

I am planning to take EECS 126 / EECS 127 / CS 189 in the future semesters.

I have taken math 54, I have taken Stats 134, should I take EE 16B before these classes?

Thanks a lot!
history.subject: How important is EE16B?
